name: Bulgaria
description: Bulgaria, a Balkan nation nestled in Southeastern Europe, boasts a diverse landscape ranging from the rugged peaks of the Rila and Pirin Mountains to the Black Sea coastline.  Rich in history, culture, and natural beauty, Bulgaria offers a unique blend of ancient traditions and modern experiences.  Its strategic location has shaped its identity, making it a crossroads of civilizations and a gateway to the Mediterranean.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The vibrant capital city, a hub of commerce, culture, and history.
quickFacts.detail: Founded in the 4th century AD, Sofia is a UNESCO World Heritage site known for its Roman ruins, Orthodox churches, and lively atmosphere.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.detail: Bulgarians are known for their warmth, generosity, and strong family values.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A land of varied terrain and stunning vistas.
quickFacts.detail: Bulgaria is the ninth-largest country in the European Union.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The Bulgarian Lev is pegged to the Euro at a rate of 1.955 BGN = 1 EUR.

quickFacts.label: Languages
quickFacts.description: The primary language spoken in Bulgaria.
quickFacts.detail: Romanian is also spoken by a significant minority population in the country's western regions.

climateData.title: Climate of Bulgaria
climateData.description: Bulgaria experiences a temperate continental climate with four distinct seasons. Summers are warm and sunny, while winters are cold and snowy, particularly in the mountainous regions. Rainfall is relatively evenly distributed throughout the year.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A time of renewal and blossoming, with wildflowers carpeting the meadows and forests.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm and sunny days, ideal for outdoor activities and exploring the countryside.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Crisp air, colorful foliage, and a sense of tranquility.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Cold and snowy conditions, perfect for skiing and snowboarding.

naturalWonders.name: Rila Mountains
naturalWonders.description: The Rila Mountains are the highest and most extensive mountain range in Bulgaria, home to the iconic Rila Monastery and a diverse array of flora and fauna. They offer breathtaking views and challenging hiking trails.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Rila Mountains are part of the Balkan Mountains and are a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The area is known for its glacial lakes, dense forests, and abundant wildlife, including brown bears and wolves.
viewingTips: Check weather conditions before heading out

naturalWonders.name: Black Sea Coast
naturalWonders.description: Bulgaria's Black Sea coast offers a beautiful blend of sandy beaches, charming seaside resorts, and historic towns. It's a popular destination for swimming, sunbathing, and water sports.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Black Sea coast is characterized by its long sandy beaches, crystal-clear waters, and diverse marine life. Sunny Beach and Golden Sands are two of the most popular resort towns.
viewingTips: Book accommodation in advance during peak season

naturalWonders.name: Pirin National Park
naturalWonders.description: Pirin National Park is a stunning mountain park known for its dramatic peaks, deep gorges, and pristine alpine lakes. It's a paradise for hikers and nature lovers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park is home to a variety of plant and animal species, including the Balkan lynx and brown bear. The Seven Rila Lakes are a particularly popular attraction within the park.
viewingTips: Carry plenty of water and snacks
Be aware of changing weather conditions

ecosystemData.title: Bulgarian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Bulgaria boasts a rich and diverse range of ecosystems, from the high-altitude mountains to the Black Sea coast and the vast plains of the Danubian Plain. These ecosystems support a remarkable variety of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Bulgaria is covered by extensive forests, primarily consisting of deciduous trees such as oak, beech, and maple.

statistics.details: Approximately 33% of Bulgaria's land area is covered by forests.
Over 120 different tree species can be found in Bulgarian forests.

notableSpecies.name: European Beech
notableSpecies.significance: A dominant species in Bulgarian forests, providing habitat for a wide range of animals.

notableSpecies.name: European Oak
notableSpecies.significance: An important source of timber and food for wildlife.

biodiversityCategories.name: Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: Bulgaria is home to a network of wetlands, including marshes, swamps, and reed beds, which are vital habitats for migratory birds and other wildlife.

statistics.details: Approximately 1.8% of Bulgaria's land area is covered by wetlands.
Over 200 bird species rely on Bulgarian wetlands for breeding and feeding.

notableSpecies.name: White Stork
notableSpecies.significance: A migratory bird that breeds in Bulgarian wetlands.

notableSpecies.name: Black Spoonbill
notableSpecies.significance: A rare bird that visits Bulgarian wetlands during the winter months.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Bulgaria
activities.description: Bulgaria offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels, from hiking and cycling to water sports and wildlife watching.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Bulgaria's stunning mountain landscapes and scenic trails.

activities.name: Rila Mountains Hiking
activities.description: Hike to the Seven Rila Lakes, climb Musala Peak, or explore the numerous trails in the Rila Mountains.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, backpack, water, snacks, map, compass

activities.name: Pirin National Park Hiking
activities.description: Discover the dramatic landscapes of Pirin National Park, with trails for all levels of experience.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, backpack, water, snacks, map, compass

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy swimming, sunbathing, and water sports along Bulgaria's beautiful Black Sea coast.

activities.name: Swimming
activities.description: Relax on the sandy beaches and take a refreshing dip in the Black Sea.

activities.name: Windsurfing
activities.description: Catch the wind and ride the waves along the Black Sea coast.
safety: Take a lesson from a qualified instructor

clothing.winter: Warm coat, hat, gloves, scarf, waterproof boots

equipment.hiking: Sturdy hiking boots, map, compass, trekking poles
